com.bluegosling.streams

Interface FluentStream<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element produced by the stream
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, BaseStream<T,Stream<T>>, Stream<T>

    public interface FluentStream<T>
extends Stream<T>
    A fluent stream is a Stream that provides extra operations, including extensibility in the ability to define new intermediate operators.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface java.util.stream.Stream

        Stream.Builder<T>

        Returns a stream that is the concatenation of this stream and then given stream.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • concat

      • zip

        default <U,R> FluentStream<R> zip(Stream<? extends U> other,
                                  BiFunction<? super T,? super U,? extends R> combiner)
        Returns a stream that combines the elements emitted by this stream and the given stream, pairwise, in their natural encounter order, using the given combining function.

        The resulting stream is exhausted when the shorter of this stream or the given one is exhausted, with remaining elements in the longer stream being discarded.

        Parameters:
        other - a stream
        combiner - a function that combines an element from this stream and an element from the given stream
        Returns:
        a stream that combines the elements of this stream and the given stream, pairwise
        See Also:
        MoreStreams.zip(Iterable)

      • zip

        default <U,V,R> FluentStream<R> zip(Stream<? extends U> other1,
                                    Stream<? extends V> other2,
                                    TriFunction<? super T,? super U,? super V,? extends R> combiner)
        Returns a stream that combines the elements emitted by this stream the given two streams, in their natural encounter order, using the given combining function.
        Parameters:
        other1 - a stream
        other2 - another stream
        combiner - a function that combines elements from this stream and elements from the given two streams
        Returns:
        a stream that combines the elements of this stream and the given two streams
        See Also:
        MoreStreams.zip(Iterable)

      • batch

        FluentStream<List<T>> batch(int count)
        Returns a stream that batches the source elements in lists of the given size.
        Parameters:
        count - the size of batches in the output stream
        Returns:
        a stream that batches source elements

      • groupBy

        <K,V> FluentStream<Map.Entry<K,Collection<V>>> groupBy(Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor,
                                                       Function<? super T,? extends V> valueExtractor)
        Returns a stream that groups elements in this stream by keys computed by the given function. The given key extractor computes grouping keys. The given value extractor computes the values that are grouped into corresponding collections. The resulting stream consists of entries of keys and their corresponding value collections.
        Parameters:
        keyExtractor - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of this stream
        valueExtractor - a function that extracts grouped values from elements of this stream
        Returns:
        a stream that groups elements in this stream

      • groupBy

        default <K> FluentStream<Map.Entry<K,Collection<T>>> groupBy(Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor)
        Returns a stream that groups elements in this stream by keys computed by the given function. The given key extractor computes grouping keys. The grouped values are the actual elements of this stream. The default implementation is as follows:
         stream.groupBy(keyExtractor, Function.identity());
        Parameters:
        keyExtractor - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of this stream
        Returns:
        a stream that groups elements in this stream

      • fork

        Supplier<FluentStream<T>> fork(int numForks)
        Forks this stream into the given number of result streams, each with the same data as this stream.
        Parameters:
        numForks - the number of resulting forks
        Returns:
        a supplier from which each fork is retrieved
        See Also:
        MoreSpliterators.fork(Spliterator, int)

      • fork

        default Pair<FluentStream<T>,FluentStream<T>> fork()
        Forks this stream into two.
        Returns:
        the pair of resulting streams, each with the same data as this stream

      • partition

        default Pair<FluentStream<T>,FluentStream<T>> partition(Predicate<? super T> criteria)
        Partitions this stream into two, with elements that match the given predicate in the first partition and elements that do not match it in the second partition.
        Parameters:
        criteria - the predicate used to partition the stream
        Returns:
        the pair of resulting streams, each with a disparate subset of this stream

      • join

        <K,U,V,W,X> FluentStream<X> join(Stream<? extends U> other,
                                 Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor1,
                                 Function<? super T,? extends V> valueExtractor1,
                                 Function<? super U,? extends K> keyExtractor2,
                                 Function<? super U,? extends W> valueExtractor2,
                                 TriFunction<? super K,? super Collection<V>,? super Collection<W>,? extends X> combiner)
        Joins this stream with the given stream using the given functions to extract corresponding subsets and combine them.
        Parameters:
        other - a stream
        keyExtractor1 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of this stream
        valueExtractor1 - a function that extracts grouped values from elements of this stream
        keyExtractor2 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of the other stream
        valueExtractor2 - a function that extracts grouped values from elements of the other stream
        combiner - a function that combines corresponding values from this and the other stream
        Returns:
        a stream that is the joined result of this stream and the given stream

      • join

        default <K,U,V> FluentStream<V> join(Stream<? extends U> other,
                                     Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor1,
                                     Function<? super U,? extends K> keyExtractor2,
                                     TriFunction<? super K,? super Collection<T>,? super Collection<U>,? extends V> combiner)
        Joins this stream with the given stream using the given functions to extract corresponding subsets and combine them. The grouped values are the elements of the stream, as opposed to values extracted from the stream via functions. The default implementation is as follows:
         stream.join(other,
     keyExtractor1, Function.identity(),
     keyExtractor2, Function.identity(),
     combiner);
        Parameters:
        other - a stream
        keyExtractor1 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of this stream
        keyExtractor2 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of the other stream
        combiner - a function that combines corresponding values from this and the other stream
        Returns:
        a stream that is the joined result of this stream and the given stream

      • join

        default <K,U,V,W> FluentStream<Triple<K,Collection<V>,Collection<W>>> join(Stream<? extends U> other,
                                                                           Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor1,
                                                                           Function<? super T,? extends V> valueExtractor1,
                                                                           Function<? super U,? extends K> keyExtractor2,
                                                                           Function<? super U,? extends W> valueExtractor2)
        Joins this stream with the given stream using the given functions to extract corresponding subsets. The default implementation is as follows:
         stream.join(other,
     keyExtractor1, valueExtractor1,
     keyExtractor2, valueExtractor2,
     Triple::of);
        Parameters:
        other - a stream
        keyExtractor1 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of this stream
        valueExtractor1 - a function that extracts grouped values from elements of this stream
        keyExtractor2 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of the other stream
        valueExtractor2 - a function that extracts grouped values from elements of the other stream
        Returns:
        a stream that is the joined result of this stream and the given stream

      • join

        default <K,U> FluentStream<Triple<K,Collection<T>,Collection<U>>> join(Stream<? extends U> other,
                                                                       Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor1,
                                                                       Function<? super U,? extends K> keyExtractor2)
        Joins this stream with the given stream using the given functions to extract corresponding subsets. The default implementation is as follows:
         stream.join(other,
     keyExtractor1, Function.identity(),
     keyExtractor2, Function.identity(),
     Triple::of);
        Parameters:
        other - a stream
        keyExtractor1 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of this stream
        keyExtractor2 - a function that extracts a grouping key from elements of the other stream
        Returns:
        a stream that is the joined result of this stream and the given stream

      • upgrade

        static <T> FluentStream<T> upgrade(Stream<T> stream)
        Upgrades the given stream into a fluent stream. If the given stream is already an instance of FluentStream, returns the given stream unchanged.
        Parameters:
        stream - a stream
        Returns:
        a fluent stream that represents the same data as the given stream

      • fromSpliterator

        static <T> FluentStream<T> fromSpliterator(Spliterator<? extends T> spliterator)
        Creates a fluent stream from the given spliterator. The returned stream will be sequential, unless explicitly configured otherwise.
        Parameters:
        spliterator - a source of data
        Returns:
        a stream of the given data
        See Also:
        StreamSupport.stream(Spliterator, boolean)

      • fromSpliterator

        static <T> FluentStream<T> fromSpliterator(Supplier<? extends Spliterator<? extends T>> spliterator,
                                           int characteristics)
        Creates a fluent stream from the given spliterator source, with the given characteristics. The returned stream will be sequential, unless explicitly configured otherwise.
        Parameters:
        spliterator - a supplier of the source of data
        characteristics - the characteristics of the source of data
        Returns:
        a stream of the given data
        See Also:
        StreamSupport.stream(Supplier, int, boolean)

      • fromSpliterator

        static <T> FluentStream<T> fromSpliterator(Supplier<? extends Spliterator<? extends T>> spliterator,
                                           int characteristics,
                                           Comparator<? super T> comparator)
        Creates a fluent stream from the given spliterator source, with the given characteristics and the given comparator if the source of data is sorted. The returned stream will be sequential, unless explicitly configured otherwise.
        Parameters:
        spliterator - a supplier of the source of data
        characteristics - the characteristics of the source of data
        comparator - the comparator, if the given source of data is sorted
        Returns:
        a stream of the given data
        See Also:
        StreamSupport.stream(Supplier, int, boolean)
